document.docAuthor: Martínez, David Camilo, Galindo-Malagón, Ximena Alejandra, Molano, Fredy & Moreira, Felipe Ferraz Figueiredo
document.masterDocTitle: Descriptions, records, and key to the Hydrometra Latreille, 1796 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Hydrometridae) from Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Descriptions, records, and key to the Hydrometra Latreille, 1796 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Hydrometridae) from Colombia

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of
Hydrometra
from Colombia

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Anterior margin of clypeus excavated ( Fig. 9c ); all acetabula without circular pits...................
Hydrometra comata

-. Anterior margin of clypeus not excavated ( Figs. 1b , 2b , 3b , 4b , 5b , 6b , 9 a–b, 9d–e); at least pro- and mesoacetabula with circular pits ( Figs. 1d , 2d , 3d , 4d , 5c , 6d )....................................................................... 2
2. Pro- and mesoacetabula with at most 7 circular pits each ( Figs. 5c , 6d )........................................... 3
-. Pro- and mesoacetabula with at least 13 circular pits each ( Figs. 1d , 2d , 3d , 4d ).................................... 5

3. Metacetabulum without circular pits; male abdominal sternum VII with a pair of spinose projections anteriorly ( Figs. 10 a–b)....................................................................................
Hydrometra argentina

-. Metacetabulum with circular pits ( Fig. 5c , Fig. 6d ); male abdominal sternum VII with brushes, setae, depression or subconical processes............................................................................................ 4

5. Clypeus very broad, with sides parallel ( Fig. 9e ); male abdominal sternum VII with a pair of short, mammilose projections near anterior margin ( Figs. 10 e–f); male abdominal segment VIII with a tubercle covered by setae on each side ( Figs. 10 e–f)…
Hydrometra olallai

-. Clypeus narrower, with sides rounded or converging anteriorly ( Figs. 1b , 2b , 3b , 4b , 9b, 9d ); male abdominal sternum VII with a pair of brushes of setae ( Figs. 1 e–f, 10c–d, 10i–j) or a pair of subconical processes ( Figs. 3 e–f, 4e–f); male abdominal segment VIII with or without lateral tubercles.................................................................. 6
-. Clypeus with anterior margin rounded ( Figs. 1b , 2b , 3b , 4b ). General color yellow, yellowish brown or brown............ 8

7. Clypeus with an angular median projection anteriorly ( Fig. 9d ); male abdominal sternum VII with brushes located on the posterior half of the segment ( Figs. 10 i–j)....................................................
Hydrometra guianana

-. Clypeus with a blunt median projection anteriorly ( Fig. 9b ); male abdominal sternum VII with brushes located on the middle of the segment ( Figs. 10 c–d).............................................................
Hydrometra caraiba
8. General color yellow or yellowish brown ( Figs. 1 , 2 , 3 ); dorsal interocular groove present............................ 9

-. General color dark brown ( Fig. 4 ); dorsal interocular groove absent; male abdominal sternum VII with a pair of subconical processes ( Figs. 4 e–f). Female unknown..........................................
Hydrometra quimbaya
sp. nov.

9. General color yellow ( Fig. 3 ); clypeus broader, with lateral and posterior margins rounded ( Fig. 3b ); dorsal and ventral interocular groove shallow; male abdominal sternite VII with a pair of subconical processes ( Figs. 3 e–f). Female unknown......................................................................................
Hydrometra tayrona
sp. nov.

-. General color yellowish brown ( Figs. 1 , 2 ); clypeus narrower, with lateral margins straight ( Figs. 1b , 2b ); dorsal and ventral interocular groove deep; brushes of male abdominal sternite VII subrectangular ( Figs. 1 e–f).....................................................................................................
Hydrometra colombiana
sp. nov.
